metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1207 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Double-free vulnerability in libavformat/mov.c in FFMPEG in Google Chrome 41.0.2251.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and crash) via a crafted .m4a file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-browser-l10n - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-chromedriver - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
No subscription required

ffmpeg - 2.6
libavcodec-extra - 2.6
libavcodec-extra57 - 2.6
libavcodec57 - 2.6
libavdevice57 - 2.6
libavfilter-extra - 2.6
libavfilter-extra6 - 2.6
libavfilter6 - 2.6
libavformat57 - 2.6
libavresample3 - 2.6
libavutil55 - 2.6
libpostproc54 - 2.6
libswresample2 - 2.6
libswscale4 - 2.6
No subscription required
